adapter.name: regexText-adapter
adapter.label: Regex Text Inbound Adapter
adapter.description: Capable of receiving text data in CSV (or similar) format, but with an attribute separator that can be defined by a regular expression.

propertyDefinition.label: Create Unrecognized Event Definitions
propertyDefinition.description: Determines if the adapter will create a new message definition for messages whose format is not defined in the server.

propertyDefinition.label: Message Separator
propertyDefinition.description: Enter the literal characters, comma (,) semi (;) or slash (/) for example, used as message delimiters in your input stream. Specify \n for a line feed, \r for a carriage return, and \t for a tab character. Unicode values are supported such as \u0020 for an ASCII space.

propertyDefinition.label: Attribute Separator
propertyDefinition.description: Enter the literal characters, comma (,) semi (;) or slash (/) for example, used as attribute delimiters in your input stream. Specify \n for a line feed, \r for a carriage return, and \t for a tab character.

propertyDefinition.label: Attribute Separator to be Replaced
propertyDefinition.description: If your attribute delimiters are more complex - for example they consist of more than one character, or can be identified by a regular expression, then enter here the appropriate regular expression that will match them. For example, a value of '[^\S\n]+' would match any amount of white space (except a new line). All occurrences of this regex will be replaced by the Attribute Separator you specify, prior to further processing by the Text Adapter, so be sure that the Attribute Separator is not set to a character that is present in the data.

propertyDefinition.label: Incoming Data Contains GeoEvent Definition
propertyDefinition.description: When this property is False, all incoming data is assumed to be in the same format. When True, each incoming GeoEvent can be a different type, and the first field is the name of its GeoEvent Definition.

propertyDefinition.label: Create Fixed GeoEvent Definitions
propertyDefinition.description: Determines if the adapter will create a new GeoEvent Definition that is derived from the first incoming GeoEvent.

propertyDefinition.label: GeoEvent Definition Name (New)
propertyDefinition.description: The name of the GeoEvent Definition to create. The first incoming GeoEvent will be used to determine the structure of the new GeoEvent Definition.

propertyDefinition.label: GeoEvent Definition Name (Existing)
propertyDefinition.description: The name of the existing GeoEvent Definition to use when interpreting incoming data. Any incoming data that does not match the schema of this GeoEvent Definition will be discarded.

propertyDefinition.label: Build Geometry From Fields
propertyDefinition.description: Determines if the adapter should use separate fields in the data to build a point geometry. If you expect the x and y values of each event to come in as separate fields, make sure this property is set.

propertyDefinition.label: X Geometry Field
propertyDefinition.description: The name of the field that has the X (or Horizontal, or longitude) part of the Geometry

propertyDefinition.label: Y Geometry Field
propertyDefinition.description: The name of the field that has the Y (or Vertical, or latitude) part of the Geometry

propertyDefinition.label: Z Geometry Field
propertyDefinition.description: The name of the field that has the Z (or Depth or Altitude part of the Geometry. This is optional. If blank the z value will be set to 0

propertyDefinition.label: wkid Geometry Field
propertyDefinition.description: The name of the field that has the WKID of your geometry's horizontal coordinate system. This is optional. If blank, the geometry will use 4326 (WGS84)

propertyDefinition.label: Well Known Text Geometry Field
propertyDefinition.description: The name of the field that has the well known text representation of the horizontal coordinate system. This is optional. If blank, the geometry will use 4326 (WGS84)

propertyDefinition.label: Expected Date Format
propertyDefinition.description:
Incoming data will use this date format. Date Format is specified using standard Java conventions:
G - Era designator.
y - Year.
M - Month in year.
w - Week in year.
W - Week in month.
D - Day in year.
d - Day in month.
F - Day of week in month.
E - Day in week.
a - Am/pm marker.
H - Hour in day (0-23).
k - Hour in day (1-24).
K - Hour in am/pm (0-11).
h - Hour in am/pm (1-12).
m - Minute in hour.
s - Second in minute.
S - Millisecond.
z - Time zone (General time zone).
Z - Time zone (RFC 822 time zone)
